Sentence:
Meaning: “Here” means in this place, where the speaker is.

Illustration idea: A person pointing to the ground at their feet with a label “Here.”

There: in or at that place, not here.

Illustration idea: A simple map with a “Here” dot and a distant dot labeled “There.”

Meaning: A word used to show that something belongs to me.

Illustration idea: Draw a person pointing to a backpack labeled “my bag.”

Your: a possessive word meaning “belonging to you.”

Illustration idea: Draw a person labeled “you” with an arrow pointing to a backpack labeled “your backpack.”

Go: to move from one place to another; to leave or begin.

Illustration idea: A person stepping out of a doorway with one foot forward.

Come: to move toward someone or someplace; to arrive.

Illustration idea: Show a person waving “Come here” while another person walks toward them.

Cry: to let out tears, often with sounds, because you feel sad, hurt, or very upset.

Illustration idea: a child sitting on the floor with tears streaming down their cheeks.

Meaning: the taste of food or drink.

Illustration idea: Show three ice cream scoops labeled vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry to represent different flavours.

Foul smell: a very bad, unpleasant odor that makes you want to move away.

Illustration idea: A trash bin overflowing, with wavy stink lines and a person pinching their nose.

Friend: a person you like and trust who cares about you.

Illustration idea: Two people sharing an umbrella in the rain.

Meaning: With each other; in the same place or acting as one group.

Illustration idea: Two hands holding each other.

Meaning: A small, narrow river that flows through the land.

Illustration idea: Draw a winding blue strip of water with a few rocks and grass along its banks.

Hill peak: the highest point on a hill—the very top.

Illustration idea: Draw a rounded hill with a small flag at the top to mark the peak.

Cave: a large natural hole or space in the ground or in the side of a hill or mountain, often dark and rocky.

Illustration idea: Draw a hillside with a dark opening and a person holding a flashlight at the entrance.

Down: toward a lower place or level; moving from high to low.
Illustration: A ball rolling down a hill.

Up: moving or pointing toward a higher place or level.

Illustration idea: A balloon rising into the sky.

Meaning: being by yourself, with no one else around.

Illustration idea: A single person sitting on a bench in an empty park.

Village: a small group of homes and other buildings in the countryside, where a small number of people live close together.

Illustration idea: Show a cluster of small houses with one narrow road and fields around.

Head: the top part of your body that holds your brain, eyes, ears, nose, and mouth.

Illustration idea: Draw a simple stick figure and circle the head.

Girl: a female child or young female person.

Illustration idea: draw a smiling young child with a ponytail and a backpack.

Marriage is when two people make a formal promise to share their lives as partners.

Illustration idea: Two interlocking rings.

Fields: large open areas of land, often covered with grass or crops; it can also mean a subject area of study or work.

Illustration idea: Show a wide green meadow with rows of crops and a fence under a blue sky.

Women: adult female people; the plural of “woman.”
Illustration idea: a simple drawing of a group of adult women standing together.

Meaning: A day when it’s very hot outside.

Illustration idea: A big bright sun with heat waves.

Forest: A large area of land covered with many trees and plants, often home to wildlife.

Illustration idea: A winding path through tall, closely packed trees with dappled sunlight.

Estimate: a careful guess about an amount, size, or cost based on what you know.

Illustration idea: Show someone looking at a jar of coins and writing “about 50 coins.”
Which word would you like me to define? I’ll give a simple meaning and one illustration idea.

Distribution: the act of giving or delivering things from one source to many people or places, or how those things are spread out.

Illustration idea: A central warehouse with arrows pointing to several stores receiving boxes.

Message: a piece of information that you send or receive.

Illustration idea: a phone screen showing a new text message bubble.
Which word would you like me to explain? Share the word, and I’ll give a short, simple definition and one illustration idea.

Really: shows that something is true, not pretend; or makes a word stronger, like “very.”

Illustration: A person bites a lemon and says, “It’s really sour.”

Meaning: “Oh no” is an exclamation showing surprise, worry, or dismay when something bad or unwanted happens.

Illustration idea: A person watching their ice cream fall off the cone, saying “Oh no!”

What: A question word used to ask for information about something, or to show surprise.

Illustration idea: A person looking at a strange object with a speech bubble saying, “What?”

Meaning: Used to ask for a reason or explanation.

Illustration idea: A child looking out at the rain asking, “Why is it raining?”

Done: finished; no more work is needed.

Illustration idea: a checklist with all items ticked.

Hurry: to move or do something quickly because there isn’t much time.
Illustration idea: A person sprinting to catch a closing bus while a clock shows time running out.

Meaning: An adult woman; a polite or respectful term for a woman, sometimes one of high social rank.

Illustration idea: Draw an adult woman in a neat dress and hat, standing with graceful posture.

Man: an adult male human.

Illustration idea: Draw a simple adult male figure standing.

Meaning: At no time; not ever.

Illustration idea: A calendar with every day crossed out.

Meaning: A young male person, usually a child.

Illustration idea: Draw a smiling child in a T-shirt kicking a soccer ball.

Meaning: A natural rest when you are not awake; eyes closed, body and mind recharge.

Illustration idea: Draw a person in bed with eyes closed and small “Z” letters above their head.

Go there (idiom): to start talking about a sensitive, awkward, or taboo topic. Also literal: to travel to that place.

Illustration idea: Two friends chatting; one brings up a tricky subject, and the other says, “Let’s not go there.”

Meaning: The front part of your head with eyes, nose, and mouth that shows feelings.

Illustration idea: Draw a simple circle with two dots for eyes, a small line for the nose, and a curved line for a smile.

Meaning: A small rodent with a long tail that often lives near people and searches for food.

Illustration idea: Draw a gray rat with a long pink tail sniffing beside a trash can.

Meaning: Utensils are simple tools used to cook or eat food, like spoons, forks, knives, and pans.

Illustration idea: Draw a spoon, fork, knife, and a frying pan neatly arranged together.

Girl: a female child or young person.

Illustration idea: Draw a smiling school-age child with pigtails holding a backpack.

Meaning: A request telling someone to move toward the speaker, to this spot.

Illustration idea: A person making a beckoning hand gesture while saying “Come here,” and another person stepping closer.

Salt: A white mineral that makes food taste better and helps keep food from spoiling.

Illustration idea: A hand sprinkling white grains from a shaker onto fries.

Meaning: A wide, open area of land, often covered with grass or crops.

Illustration idea: Show a large green expanse with rows of crops stretching toward the horizon.

Headache: a pain or pressure in your head.

Illustration idea: A person holding their head, with zigzag lines around the temples to show pain.

Fall: to move or drop from a higher place to a lower place, often by accident or because of gravity.

Illustration idea: A single leaf dropping from a tree to the ground.

Children: young people who are still growing and not adults yet.
Illustration idea: Draw kids playing together in a park.

Elders: older people in a family or community, often respected for their experience and wisdom.

Illustration idea: Draw a gray-haired person kindly advising a child while pointing to a book.

Meaning: A fever is when your body temperature is higher than normal, usually from illness. You may feel hot, sweaty, or get chills.

Illustration idea: Show a person with a thermometer in their mouth showing a high (red) reading.

Soup: A hot, liquid food made by cooking ingredients like vegetables or meat in water or broth.

Illustration idea: A steaming bowl with a spoon, showing visible pieces of carrot and noodles.

Remembrance: the act of remembering and honoring someone or something from the past.
Illustrate: a single lit candle beside a framed photograph.

Rivulet: a very small stream of water.

Illustration idea: Show a thin trickle of water winding through grass after a rain.

Clever: quick-thinking and inventive; good at finding smart solutions.

Illustration idea: A kid uses a paperclip to fix a broken backpack zipper.

Pajama: Comfortable clothes worn for sleeping, usually a matching shirt and pants.

Illustration idea: Draw a folded pajama set (button-up shirt and pants) with a moon-and-stars pattern beside a pillow.

Slate: a flat, gray rock that splits into thin sheets, used for roofs and tiles.

Illustration idea: Draw a gray roof covered with overlapping slate tiles.

Guests: people invited to visit or stay at a place, like your home or an event.

Illustration idea: A host opening the front door to welcome smiling visitors.

Suddenly: happening very quickly and without warning.

Illustration idea: A quiet balloon instantly popping with a loud “bang.”

Soyabean: an edible bean from the soy plant, rich in protein, used for food products and oil.

Illustration idea: Show a green pod split open with the pale beans inside.

Scratch: to rub or scrape the skin or a surface with something sharp (like a fingernail), often to stop an itch, sometimes leaving a small mark.

Illustration idea: A hand scratching an itchy forearm.

Company: a business organization; also, the people you spend time with.
Illustration idea: An office building with a logo on its facade.

Meaning: The day before today.

Illustration idea: A calendar showing today highlighted, with the previous day labeled “yesterday.”

Tomorrow: the day after today.
Illustration idea: A calendar with today circled and an arrow pointing to the next day labeled “Tomorrow.”
